runs.comm: the first ball is sent through midwicket with a neat-looking push. It was a full delivery and on the pads
he corrects his length and bowls this one of off, the batsman comes forward and defends
this one comes in after pitching, but Pun, who was on the back foot, dabs it to the leg side for a quick single
well bowled! This one jags away from a length and squares up Khakurel. He is beaten
wonderful shot! He plants his front foot out and uses a lot of bottom hand to punch this fuller delivery straight past mid-on. Very stylish shot
he comes on the front foot and defends the length delivery towards leg side
good bounce for Haseeb! This one climbs from a length, but Pun does well to drop it down the pitch
this one is fuller and Pun chooses to stay back to it, opens the face very late to run it to third man for a single
oh that is hammered down the ground! It was full and wide and instead of choosing to go towards cover, Khakurel blasts it straight down the ground, but mid-off makes a good diving save
more bounce from length this time, the batsman defends it to point
well, he has seen enough! It was a length ball, swinging away, but Khakurel throws his bat like he wants to send it to the city, but makes no connection
that bottom hand is on show again as Khakurel whips the length ball from middle stump to powerfully drive it through midwicket. Second boundary for Nepal
what a ball that one! Takes off from a length and flies past the outside edge. Why don't they have that slip fielder?
there you go! this one takes the edge and flies through second slip area, to third man
he dabs the back of length delivery to midwicket for a quick single
stays in the crease and works the back of length delivery towards square leg for another single. Good bounce on this pitch
short this time and at 123 kph, that is not going to trouble anyone. The batsman comes forward, then leans backward to pull it away to the square leg boundary
slower delivery on off stump, the batsman pushes it back to the bowler
and he is greeted with a dance down the pitch, the batsman smashes it over the umpire's head for a boundary
he stays in the crease and runs it down to short third man for a single
full and on the pads, Khakurel punches it firmly to wide long on for another single
they are not holding themselves back! This time it's Pun, choosing a lovely inside out drive over the infield. His first boundary
he comes forward and defends this one back down the pitch
charges out of the crease, but the bowler fires this one quicker on the blockhole. Pun digs it out towards cover
Another one blasted to the leg side! Haseeb bowls a short one outside off, but he doesn't have much pace and the batsman uses a tennis forehand to whack it to the deep midwicket boundary
he does beat the batsman this time! It was a similar delivery, but Khakurel goes for a loose poke and is beaten by the slight away movement
he pushes this one down the leg side and it's called a wide
good tight delivery on off stump, the batsman blocks it to the leg side for a quick single

Whatta catch! Sagar Pun perishes playing an aerial punch, but this one was hit hard, very hard and the fielder at cover does well to dive to his right and pouch the catch with both hands. First blow for Hong Kong
he stays in the crease and punches the length delivery to cover
he keeps it tight around off stump and Malla isn't in any hurry, defends this to the off side

he strikes first ball! Well, Khakurel has thrown it away. It's a full delivery, slightly flatter, and Khakurel looks to chip it over the mid-on fielder but is not able to get under it. He ends up lobbing it for the fielder at mid-on. Both openers have not departed after what looked like a very good start
pushed through on the stumps, the batsman defends it to the leg side
this one is fired a bit quicker, but it's down the leg side. A good take by the keeper prevents extras
the captain is going to open with a boundary too! this one was tossed up outside off, but Khadka uses a slog sweep to lift it over wide mid-on
stays in the crease and defends the length delivery down the pitch
the line is slightly leg sidish, which invites the sweep, but Khadka only manages to get a top edge that runs down fine on the leg side
full and flat on off, the batsman defends it to the leg side
starts off with a length delivery just outside off, the batsman drops it to the off side and calls for a quick single
bowls it just back of length and extracts good bounce from the pitch, it's defended to the off side
he stays on the back foot to punch the 137 kph back of length delivery to point
he has to hop on his toes as the bounce gets big on him, but smartly whips it towards square leg for a single
looks to pull the short ball from outside off, but it comes in a tough quicker on to the batsman, who is not able to get any timing on his shot
he has been bowling outside off, but changes line this time. It ends up being a wide down the leg side
he pulls this one to fine leg to keep the strike, but again, the bowler was veering towards the leg side
starts off with a short delivery down the leg side, the batsman attempts a pull and misses, but it's down the leg side anyway
this time he corrects the line to just outside off. Khadka stays in the crease and punches it down to long off to bring up the team's 50
nicely played! He controls the bounce of this back of length delivery and steers it past point for a single
good ball this time! He bowled this one from wide of the crease and the batsman can only punch it down the pitch
short and wide outside off, Khadka surely loves to pull as he tries to drag the ball towards midwicket, but can't beat the fielder in the infield
he waits on the back foot and punches the rising delivery straight to cover
good tight stuff from Aizaz, who keeps firing it on off stump line. The batsman punches it to mid off
cracker of a delivery! It was quick at 140 kph, pitches around off, then swings away late to beat the defensive push
some hesitation as Malla calls for a single to point and that could have been trouble has the throw from the fielder hit the stumps
he doesn't move his feet but drives the length delivery on the up, straight to point though
this is full and heading down the leg side, but Khadka was probably not expecting it and misses out on his flick, get hit on the pads
this time it's further down the leg side
this one is down the leg side too, Nepal wouldn't mind these extras
this one is caressed through the covers, but there is protection in the deep! The bowler rolled his fingers trying to bowl it slower, but it was full and wide outside off
that's better from Irfan! Fast, short of length, seaming away. It beats the bat. Why bowl here and there, up and down, when you can do that with pace
he walks right across to the off side to flick it fine, but makes no connection. It bounces over the leg stump
short delivery, the batsman pulls it in the air but doesn' t really get the timing he wants. That's good for him because there was a fielder in the deep and the ball reaches him after a bounce
Khadka is very lucky here! He goes for his favourite pull, but the ball comes in too quickly into him. He gets a leading edge that just lobs behind the bowler
they all seem to be good with these low-grip shots! The fuller delivery is punched down the ground to long on by Malla with a lot of bottom hand
he stays on the back foot and punches the back of length delivery to long off
he hops on his toes and flicks the back of length delivery, but is not able to beat the man at short fine leg
pushed through to the off stump line, but the batsman goes back and punches it to wide long on for a well-run second
loud appeal for lbw as the batsman goes down on his knee to play the sweep, the umpire probably reckoned this one would have bounces over
he waits in the crease and wrists this one to midwicket for a quick single
what an attractive shot that is! Khadka comes down the pitch, reaches the pitch of the delivery and plays a beautiful inside out drive over extra cover

Oh no! Najeeb did everything right but he doesn't have a wicket! He saw the batsman come down the pitch, slowed down the pace and foxed the batsman with it. Khadka went over the top anyway, but he didn't time that at all. It went straight to long on where the fielder dropped the sitter of sitters.
he waits in the crease and defends this length delivery to off
he attempts a sweep from one bowled full and wide outside off, misses it as it passes under his bat
this one is outside off too, but not as full as the last one. The batsman chooses the sweep anyway and plays it to deep midwicket
nice wristy push from Khadka this time, they pick up a good two runs to deep midwicket
he skips down the track and whacks the length delivery to deep midwicket for a single, didn't get any elevation in that shot
tossed up and full, the batsman makes room and drives it to long off for a single
he uses his feet again, but the bowler bowls it flat. Khadka doesn't swing across the line, he punches it down to long on with a straight bat
he starts off with a length delivery on off, the batsman comes forward and drives it to long off for a single
he shuffles across and thumps the fuller length delivery over midwicket with a cross-batted swipe. Good shot, as the ball was coming in with the angle
he shuffles to the off side again, but the bowler pushes it down the leg side, too far down
here comes the scoop! the batsman goes all the way to the off side to try and ramp it over the keeper's head, but he makes no connection as the ball bounces a touch extra
he goes full this time, the batsman can only dig it out towards cover
tries to mow it over towards long on, but he gets it on the splice of the bat and ends up chipping it over the bowler's head for a single

that has been clobbered! Full and outside off, but it doesn't matter as it's in Khadka hitting arc. He whacks it over midwicket to the cow corner where the fielder makes a valiant attempt, but lets it slip through to the boundary
oye hoye! A reverse sweep now, but it's too full and slides under the bat
he makes a lot of room to carve it over the off side, but the bowler smartly slows it down. The batsman is made to wait, but he only edges it to short third man for a single
full and on the stumps, Khadka flicks it to deep midwicket for a single
he walks across to the offside and sweeps a full delivery from outside off to deep midwicket for a single
he beats the man at long off with a powerful drive down the ground! He comes down the pitch, lifts it with a straight bat for yet another boundary
now Khadka attempts a reverse paddle, but misses as it's wider than he anticipated
he starts the new over with a wide outside off, it's too far away and the batsman misses even as he tries to stretch and reach it
he waits on the back foot and punches the length ball to cover
he stays in the crease and punches the back of length delivery to wide of long off and they come back for a second

interesting! Very interesting! The batsman waits in the crease and some how summons enough energy to whack the length delivery over mid-off, didn't look like he was in control but that travelled far enough
now he goes for a heave to the leg side and gets a thick outside edge to third man, where a misfield allows for a second
no doubt about this one though! It was short and Malla murders it with a muscular pull to the midwicket boundary
he bowls a good yorker outside off and the batsman can only take a single to long off
he looks for a pull, but gets a top edge that lands safely behind the bowler
what a good yorker that one! The batsman was moving to the leg side to make room, but he couldn't do anything about it, digs it out back towards the bowler
another short ball, another powerful pull! This one floats in the air before landing safely at cow corner. They pick up a couple
length delivery on the stumps and Khadka whacks it across the line to deep midwicket for a single
fuller delivery on off stump, the batsman drives it firmly past the bowler, who does well to get out of the way
a good slower delivery this time, the batsman was looking to pull it down fine on the leg side, but gets hit on the pads. They take extras for leg bye

another drop! Khadka is the beneficiary again. The batsman was beaten by the flight and slowness as he looked to power it down the ground. The fielder from extra cover ran backwards, but couldn't hold on to a catch. It should have been long off's catch ideally

no, his luck runs out this time! Again, Khadka looks to launch it out of the ground and makes a much better connection compared to the last ball, but can only hit it to long on. A good innings comes to an end
this time in three balls, the ball is up in the air as the batsman gets a thick top edge, but it falls safely at midwicket again. The bowler ran all the way, but couldn't get there in time
now he walks across to off and plays a powerful sweep shot that has enough legs to beat the deep backward square leg fielder
another powerful agricultural mow across the line, but it heads straight to the deep midwicket fielder
he waits for this one and dabs it to square leg for a single to keep the strike

they are on the fast lane and not slowing down! This one was full and the batsman threw his bat at it anyway, but only manages to hit it high, not long. It sails up in the night sky, and the fielder running in from long on manages to hold on to a smart catch
too full this time, the batsman goes down on his knee and sweeps it firmly to deep backward square leg
slower this time from the bowler, the batsman is not able to get it away
this is a low full toss and it's driven straight down the ground for a comfortable couple

A misfield followed by a brilliant piece of work by the long off fielder! It was driven all along the ground, straight to extra cover, who allowed it to pass through, but the fielder in the deep dived across to prevent a certain boundary
goes for a reverse sweep, but hit straight to the short third man fielder
it's a good yorker on the middle stump that the batsman manages to squeeze out towards cover for a single
another good delivery and the batsman hits it straight to cover, but takes off for a single anyway. Had that hit, he would have been out by a mile
slower delivery wide outside off, makes the batsman wait and he can only push it as far as cover
full and pacy outside off, the batsman went for a full-blooded heave, but plays down the wrong line
another heave to a full delivery and it gets him a boundary! He was looking to hit it down the ground, but ends up slicing it over point and the ball trickles to the rope
much better this time from the batsman! It's a similar delivery and ends up as a boundary in the same area, but the intent was to hit it to that side this time, hence the improved timing

whoa! That's the first six of the innings! It was an attempted yorker that ended up being a low full toss, but that was some shot to pick that up with a powerful bottom hand and send it over cow corner
goes for a pull, but doesn't get his timing right. The ball falls short of long on and they come back for a second

another short ball, another pull, but this one ends the wonderful innings as Malla top edges it for the bowler to run a few paces and take a simple catch. Malla misses his half century by a couple of runs but he has given the innings some useful impetus

another wicket as Nepal look for extra runs! The batsman punches the wide delivery to deep cover and looks for a second, but that was always going to be tight as it went straight to the fielder. Vesawkar was comfortably short of the crease
make it three in three! The batsman goes for something too cute by going across the stumps to sweep a yorker, but looses his off stump. Hong Kong are doing well to limit the damage in this over

well, four wickets in four deliveries! Another run out. The bowler finishes with an excellent yorker that the batsman digs out back towards him. It was the last ball so Nepal looked for a single anyway, but no way the bowler was going to miss hitting the stumps from a close range..
